meanings.definition: The warmest season of the year, in the northern hemisphere from June to August and in the southern hemisphere from December to February.
meanings.sent1: During summer, the sun shines brightly and the days are long.
meanings.sent2: I love going to the beach in the summer to swim and build sandcastles.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream melted quickly in the summer heat.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the air like the warmth of a summer day.
meanings.sent5: The summer heat was so intense that even the flowers seemed to wilt.

meanings.definition: To spend the summer in a particular place.
meanings.sent1: We plan to summer at the lake house this year for our vacation.
meanings.sent2: Many families choose to summer in coastal towns for a relaxing getaway.
meanings.sent3: The decision to summer in the mountains surprised their friends.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to summer in Europe to experience different cultures.
meanings.sent5: They always summer in the countryside to escape the city hustle.

meanings.definition: A horizontal timber or ledge built out from a wall to support a structure or to form a shelf.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter installed a sturdy summer to hold up the new roof.
meanings.sent2: The shelf was supported by a decorative summer that matched the room's decor.
meanings.sent3: The cat found a cozy spot on the summer by the window.
meanings.sent4: The summer provided a perfect place to display her collection of books.
meanings.sent5: He admired the craftsmanship of the intricate summer supporting the balcony.
